business_idea: AI-powered growth system that interrogates founder assumptions, diagnoses growth stage (Idea/Validation/Early Traction), and runs personalised weekly experiments to help pre-PMF companies find product-market fit — replacing expensive agencies and generic playbooks.
founder_summary: Thomas McDonough — founder who spent 6 months building a product nobody asked for, then 6 months trying every tactic blind, which led him to build Growthmind. Quote: 'The problem wasn't effort — it was that I was trying to grow without first proving what actually resonated.'

product_status.biggest_product_gap: No user conversations, no usage data, no activation metrics

primary_icp: Pre-PMF founders, solo founders, technical makers, and small teams (1-10 people) without a dedicated growth team who are trying to find product-market fit
pain_points: Burning $15k+ on agencies that guess with your money
Founder burnout from endless DIY experimentation
Generic growth playbooks fail when copied without context
80% of teams misdiagnose their growth stage
6 months of misdirected effort from wrong-stage tactics
No structured system for validating growth assumptions

persona.role: Founder / Solo Maker / Head of Marketing at early-stage startup
persona.geo: Global, English-speaking markets (UK spelling suggests UK-based founder)
persona.demographics: Technical builders who struggle with growth; non-technical founders overwhelmed by marketing

problem.pain_point: Growth decisions pre-PMF are random guesswork — agencies are expensive and generic, DIY causes burnout, and copied tactics fail without context
problem.trigger_event: Founder realises they've wasted months/money on growth tactics that don't work for their stage
problem.current_workaround: Hiring agencies ($10-20k/mo), DIY experimentation, copying tactics from blogs/Reddit, ChatGPT for generic advice
additional_pain_points: Misdiagnosing growth stage leads to premature scaling
No compounding learning loop — experiments don't build on each other
Lack of growth team expertise at early stage

meta.source_detail: growthmind.ai 'The Core Problem' and pain point sections

validation.aha_moment: Receiving personalised stage diagnosis and first experiment plan that's specific to their context, not generic advice
validation.time_to_first_value: 10 minutes to growth profile; 7 days to first validated experiment result

monetization.buyer_vs_user: Same person — the founder/growth lead is both buyer and user
monetization.why_chose_you: Interrogation-first approach that diagnoses before prescribing; 1% the cost of an agency; personalised context that persists across sessions
monetization.revenue_model: SaaS subscription — Free tier (assessment only), Starter ($20/mo), Growth ($200/mo)

identity_meta.source_detail: growthmind.ai hero section and feature descriptions
Product has live app at unicorn.growthmind.ai with pricing tiers — indicates launched
Solo founder indicated by website tone, no team page, single founder quoted
No funding info found anywhere; solo founder with no Crunchbase presence suggests bootstrapped

change_log.details: AI enrichment from growthmind.ai website and web search. Primary source: company website. No social media, Crunchbase, or Product Hunt presence found.
